title: Outlander
actors: Caitriona Balfe, Sam Heughan, Duncan Lacroix
plot: Follows the story of Claire Randall, a married combat nurse from 1945 who is mysteriously swept back in time to 1743, where she is immediately thrown into an unknown world where her life is threatened. When she is forced to marry Jamie Fraser, a chivalrous and romantic young Scottish warrior, a passionate affair is ignited that tears Claire's heart between two vastly different men in two irreconcilable lives.
awards: Nominated for 4 Primetime Emmys. Another 34 wins & 83 nominations total.

title: About Time
actors: Domhnall Gleeson, Rachel McAdams, Bill Nighy, Lydia Wilson
plot: At the age of 21, Tim discovers he can travel in time and change what happens and has happened in his own life. His decision to make his world a better place by getting a girlfriend turns out not to be as easy as you might think.
awards: 3 wins & 9 nominations.

title: Dr. House
actors: Hugh Laurie, Omar Epps, Robert Sean Leonard, Jesse Spencer
plot: An antisocial maverick doctor who specializes in diagnostic medicine does whatever it takes to solve puzzling cases that come his way using his crack team of doctors and his wits.
awards: Won 5 Primetime Emmys. Another 55 wins & 140 nominations total.

title: Grace and Frankie
actors: Jane Fonda, Lily Tomlin, Sam Waterston, Martin Sheen
plot: Finding out that their husbands are not just work partners, but have also been romantically involved for the last twenty years, two women with an already strained relationship try to cope with the circumstances together.
awards: Nominated for 13 Primetime Emmys. Another 3 wins & 62 nominations total.

title: House of the Dragon
actors: Matt Smith, Olivia Cooke, Emma D'Arcy, Milly Alcock
plot: An internal succession war within House Targaryen at the height of its power, 172 years before the birth of Daenerys Targaryen.
awards: Won 3 BAFTA Awards. Another 9 wins & 24 nominations total.

title: The Help
actors: Emma Stone, Viola Davis, Bryce Dallas Howard, Octavia Spencer
plot: An aspiring author during the civil rights movement of the 1960s decides to write a book detailing the African American maids' point of view on the white families for which they work, and the hardships they go through on a daily basis.
awards: Won 1 Oscar. Another 79 wins & 121 nominations total.

title: Game of Thrones
actors: Peter Dinklage, Lena Headey, Emilia Clarke, Kit Harington
plot: In the mythical continent of Westeros, several powerful families fight for control of the Seven Kingdoms. As conflict erupts in the kingdoms of men, an ancient enemy rises once again to threaten them all. Meanwhile, the last heirs of a recently usurped dynasty plot to take back their homeland from across the Narrow Sea.
awards: Won 59 Primetime Emmys. Another 389 wins & 634 nominations total.

title: Vikings
actors: Travis Fimmel, Clive Standen, Gustaf Skarsgård, Katheryn Winnick
plot: Vikings transports us to the brutal and mysterious world of Ragnar Lothbrok, a Viking warrior and farmer who yearns to explore--and raid--the distant shores across the ocean.
awards: Won 1 Primetime Emmy. Another 46 wins & 134 nominations total.

title: The Good Place
actors: Kristen Bell, William Jackson Harper, Jameela Jamil, D'Arcy Carden
plot: Four people and their otherworldly frienemy struggle in the afterlife to define what it means to be good.
awards: Nominated for 12 Primetime Emmys. Another 34 wins & 146 nominations total.

title: Interstellar
actors: Ellen Burstyn, Matthew McConaughey, Mackenzie Foy, John Lithgow
plot: A team of explorers travel through a wormhole in space in an attempt to ensure humanity's survival.
awards: Won 1 Oscar. Another 39 wins & 148 nominations total.

title: Avatar
actors: Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldana, Sigourney Weaver, Stephen Lang
plot: A paraplegic marine dispatched to the moon Pandora on a unique mission becomes torn between following his orders and protecting the world he feels is his home.
awards: Won 3 Oscars. Another 80 wins & 121 nominations.

title: You
actors: Penn Badgley, Victoria Pedretti, Ambyr Childers, Elizabeth Lail, Tati Gabrielle
plot: A dangerously charming, intensely obsessive young man goes to extreme measures to insert himself into the lives of those he is transfixed by.
awards: 3 wins & 10 nominations.

title: How to Get Away with Murder
actors: Viola Davis, Billy Brown, Alfred Enoch, Jack Falahee, Aja Naomi King
plot: A group of ambitious law students and their brilliant criminal defense professor become involved in a twisted murder plot that promises to change the course of their lives.
awards: Won 1 Primetime Emmy. Another 20 wins & 79 nominations total.

title: Breaking Bad
actors: Bryan Cranston, Anna Gunn, Aaron Paul, Dean Norris
plot: A high school chemistry teacher diagnosed with inoperable lung cancer turns to manufacturing and selling methamphetamine in order to secure his family's financial future.
awards: Won 16 Primetime Emmys. Another 155 wins & 247 nominations total.

title: Doctor Strange
actors: Rachel McAdams, Benedict Cumberbatch, Mads Mikkelsen, Tilda Swinton
plot: After his career is destroyed, a brilliant but arrogant and conceited surgeon gets a new lease on life when a sorcerer takes him under her wing and trains him to defend the world against evil.
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. 20 wins & 68 nominations total.

title: Insidious
actors: Patrick Wilson, Rose Byrne, Ty Simpkins, Lin Shaye
plot: A family looks to prevent evil spirits from trapping their comatose child in a realm called The Further.
awards: 8 wins & 15 nominations.

title: The Vampire Diaries
actors: Nina Dobrev, Paul Wesley, Ian Somerhalder, Kat Graham, Candice King
plot: 145 years after they are turned into vampires during a vampire hunt, Stefan and Damon Salvatore return home, a small town called Mystic Falls. Stefan returns to meet Elena Gilbert who has an uncanny resemblance to his (and his brother's) old love, Katherine Pierce. Damon returns to follow his brother and give him the eternal misery he promised him; they soon discover the war is not over.
awards: 38 wins & 67 nominations.

title: Peaky Blinders
actors: Cillian Murphy, Paul Anderson, Helen McCrory, Sophie Rundle
plot: A gangster family epic set in 1900s England, centering on a gang who sew razor blades in the peaks of their caps, and their fierce boss Tommy Shelby.
awards: Won 1 BAFTA Award. Another 22 wins & 51 nominations total.

title: Friends
actors: Jennifer Aniston, Courteney Cox, Lisa Kudrow, David Schwimmer, Matthew Perry, Matt LeBlanc
plot: Follows the personal and professional lives of six twenty to thirty year-old friends living in the Manhattan borough of New York City.
awards: Won 6 Primetime Emmys. Another 78 wins & 231 nominations total.

title: Up
actors: Edward Asner, Jordan Nagai, John Ratzenberger, Christopher Plummer
plot: 78-year-old Carl Fredricksen travels to Paradise Falls in his house equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway.
awards: Won 2 Oscars. Another 80 wins & 87 nominations total.

title: The Good Doctor
actors: Freddie Highmore, Antonia Thomas, Hill Harper, Richard Schiff
plot: Shaun Murphy, a young surgeon with autism and Savant syndrome, is recruited into the surgical unit of a prestigious hospital.
awards: 6 wins & 24 nominations.

title: Modern Family
actors: Ed O'Neill, Sofía Vergara, Julie Bowen, Ty Burrell
plot: Three different but related families face trials and tribulations in their own uniquely comedic ways.Three different but related families face trials and tribulations in their own uniquely comedic ways.
awards: Won 22 Primetime Emmys. Another 122 wins & 384 nominations total.

title: Young Sheldon
actors: Iain Armitage, Zoe Perry, Lance Barber, Montana Jordan
plot: Meet a child genius named Sheldon Cooper (already seen as an adult in Teoria Big Bang (2007)) and his family. Some unique challenges face Sheldon, who is socially impaired.
awards: 3 wins & 24 nominations.

title: Bridgerton
actors: Phoebe Dynevor, Regé-Jean Page, Nicola Coughlan, Jonathan Bailey
plot: Wealth, lust, and betrayal set against the backdrop of Regency-era England, seen through the eyes of the powerful Bridgerton family.
awards: Won 2 Primetime Emmys. Another 13 wins & 73 nominations total.

title: Reign
actors: Adelaide Kane, Megan Follows, Celina Sinden, Torrance Coombs
plot: Chronicles the rise to power of Mary Queen of Scots when she arrives in France as a 15-year-old, betrothed to Prince Francis, and with her four best friends as ladies-in-waiting. It details the secret history of survival at French Court amidst fierce foes, dark forces, and a world of sexual intrigue.
awards: 4 wins & 21 nominations.

title: Sherlock
actors: Benedict Cumberbatch, Martin Freeman, Una Stubbs, Rupert Graves
plot: In this modernized version of the Conan Doyle characters, using his detective plots, Sherlock Holmes lives in early-21st-century London and acts more cocky towards Scotland Yard's detective inspector Lestrade because he's actually less confident. Doctor Watson is now a fairly young veteran of the Afghan war, less adoring and more active.
awards: Won 9 Primetime Emmys. Another 93 wins & 183 nominations total.

title: GLOW
actors: Alison Brie, Marc Maron, Betty Gilpin, Britt Baron
plot: A look at the personal and professional lives of a group of women who perform for a wrestling organization in Los Angeles during the 1980s.
awards: Won 3 Primetime Emmys. Another 13 wins & 108 nominations total.

title: Orange Is the New Black
actors: Taylor Schilling, Kate Mulgrew, Uzo Aduba, Danielle Brooks
plot: Convicted of a decade old crime of transporting drug money to an ex-girlfriend, normally law-abiding Piper Chapman is sentenced to a year and a half behind bars to face the reality of how life-changing prison can really be.
awards: Won 4 Primetime Emmys. Another 53 wins & 150 nominations total.
